pageTitle: Neuville and Novikov join M-Sport; Loeb gives that team no chance to win | Autoweek
TableContextTimeStampBeforeTable: {4614=“Both Evgeny and Thierry were strong candidates since negotiations began,” said M-Sport head Malcolm Wilson. “They are young, but they have both shown some real maturity this year, combining obvious speed with a determination to finish all of the events and gain as much knowledge of the stages as possible. Both have regularly challenged the factory drivers, and their 2012 results were thoroughly deserved. I am confident that both drivers have more to prove and that we will see more impressive performances from them in 2013.”, 3419=Talking at the launch of the Citroen Total Abu Dhabi World Rally Team launch last week, Loeb revealed that he felt Petter Solberg was the British M-Sport squad's hope for wins in 2013. After the Frenchman heard Solberg was not going to join Mads Ostberg at M-Sport, he said: “It seems Ford [M-Sport] cannot win any rallies.”, 5344=Thierry Neuville and Evgeny Novikov have joined the Qatar M-Sport World Rally Team for the 2013 World Rally Championship., 4070=Wilson added: “We have a young team for next year, but this by no means detracts from their ability to produce some strong results. All of them, Mads, Evgeny and Thierry, proved their worth in 2012 and, with guidance from Nasser, they can all be fantastic ambassadors for Qatar, M-Sport and the WRC.”, 6410=December 15, 2012, 3634=Sebastien Loeb, meanwhile, expects Citroen to continue its devastating run of World Rally Championship form next season -- and added that he doesn't expect the Qatar M-Sport team to win at all in 2013., 2895=The official Citroen team has been designated the Nos. 1, 2 and 3 for 2013, and and when Loeb drives No. 1 will be used; Hirvonen will keep No. 2 and Sordo No. 3., 4806=While Novikov has been an M-Sport driver since 2011, Neuville switches from the rival Citroen team, where he represented the make's Junior Team and Qatar-backed efforts in 2012.}
textBeforeTable: 2015 World Rally Championship Shedule --> Comments See MoreWorld Rally Championship By Anthony Peacock “Citroen will manage without me next year,” he said. “If it is completely ready and on the level of Citroen then the two guys in Volkswagen can have some fight, but if the car is not completely ready -- because Citroen has a lot of experience of all the rallies -- for sure, it will be difficult for Volkswagen to be on the same level immediately.” Loeb says he has no fears for
